column4: hi. I want to host online games, but it appears as though a firewall is blocking me, in ubuntu 8.04 I had no problems, but something in 8.10 is stopping me
Is there a way I can disable this firewall thingy?
I turned off ufw and it doesn't change anything. perhaps IP forwarding is disabled in kernel?
Status: not loaded  (this is after $ sudo ufw disable)
i dont understand how ip-forwarding comes into play.. you wanted to disable the firewall and now it is disabled?
I want to play online games, everything worked in 8.04 but in 8.10 it behaves as though it was a firewall blocking, people can see my game but cant join, (I have forwarded router ports etc)
no ideas as to what changed in 8.10 that could be affecting me?
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)      and all the others have policy ACCEPT, target     prot opt source      destination   fields are empty
ok, no firewall active (ufw is a comfort layer on top of iptables)
let me check if theres a ubuntu network channel
you might try #ubuntu-server: they are more into networks than us
